intro: Erigeron lumbricoides, commonly known as the common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron lumbricoides is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
